description: I've been getting the same burrito from La Tortilla on Castro street for 10 years: The super vegetarian with marinated tofu (so good and hard to find!) and whole wheat tortilla.  It's always enough for two meals! They have great tasting horchata too! The women who work there are awesome and so kind especially since they have to deal with the party crowd until after 2am.
author: Mark S.

description:
Sadly disappointed both times I went in to La Tortilla. I really wanted to like this place, we need a good burrito/mexican take-away on Castro street. The first time I went in was early on a Sunday afternooon. I was craving Pozole and I had seen that it was advertised on the menu. I went in to order and then the lady at the counter told me they didnt have it.

The second time I went in for a burrito to take away around 7:45 pm and the meats looked like they'd been sitting out and not freshly prepared which initially I noticed but hoping it would be good food I ordered the burrito anyway. I wanted a spicy sauce to go on my burrito and I tried explaining that to the lady but the lady at the counter said that they only had enchilada sauce and that they only had the salsa for the chips.

The carne asada burrito was very very wet and messy. It was luke-warm. The meat was chewy and I couldn't eat most of it. It was not tender. It was quite dissapointing and rather disposable.

The worst bit was the tiny bit of Guac & cheese in it!

I LOVED Zapata Mexican Grill when it was open on 18th & Diamond. That was amazing but La Tortilla should have been the one to have closed. What a disappointment. Instead of coming back here, I will probably just go to the Mission. I imagine most of the business this place gets is from the bars after people have been drinking. 

This is not a place to come for a delicious mexican burrito!
author: Julian I.

description:
Good value for money and a generous amount of vegetarian items on the menu. Nothing is fantastic but it is good enough. Carnitas plate was good. The arroz con leche had nice cinnamon flavor but the rice should have been softer.
Convenient location and nice employees.
author: Nils H.

description:
I've been coming here for probably years--sometimes 3 days a week! It's cheap, is right next to several bus stops, and has good burritos. However, today they accused me of not paying for my burrito, and made me pay twice, so I won't be returning.

The cashier took my money and gave me change, but got distracted and went around doing different things as I waited for her to hand me my burrito which was sitting on the counter. Finally she gave it to me and I walked out the door, at which point the staff yelled at me to come back, and told me I had not paid. I told them I had, but the cashier just shook her head at me, saying I couldn't have paid because the register wasn't open. I knew that I'd paid, because I remembered paying with 2 five-dollar bills, and I now had no fives in my wallet. The burrito was $5.97, and in the mostly-empty tip jar sat 3 cents--my change in coins that I'd dumped in there. I pointed this out--"There's my 3 cents, that's from when you gave me change for $5.97 a minute ago." She wouldn't believe me, so I finally just paid again with a 20 so I wouldn't miss my bus. At this point, she gave me my change, including (I think) my 2 fives back.

Mistakes happen, that isn't the problem, but it sucked to be treated that way. I was a regular customer and saw this cashier pretty much every week, so it's not very likely that I would be trying to cheat her. I won't be coming back because this just made me feel bad!

If you like the food and prices, here are some places with similar prices and menus:
La Corneta, one very big location on Mission/24th and one smaller one in Glen Park
Casa Mexicana, one location at Church and Duboce, and one on 24 in Noe Valley
La Fonda in Inner Sunset
author: Amanda V.

description:
Amazing food... The service could have been better... had the super burrito...i could
 only finish half.  So yummy. Prices aren't bad..quick dinner date
author: Katie S.

description:
WARNING:  BONE fragments in my super taco!  BIG ONES.  They could have done SERIOUS harm to me:  my teeth, esophagus, GI track, and even choked to death.  I showed the women behind the counter and they said NOTHING!!!  They grabbed the tray and disposed of them.  

One was the size of silver dollar, the other (the shard) was the size of a WISH BONE.  THIS HAS HAPPENED on two separate visits.  The DPH will be getting a letter.
author: Bill S.

description: Let me start off by saying I loved this place until tonight... i went in as usual surprised they were still open. Really wanted a steak super burrito but the lady had little to no steak left so i asked her instead could i get al pastor and she rudely replies you want extra meat. And i kindly said no i just want a super burrito al pastor instead and she insisted if i wanted extra meat. After going back and forth she rudely walked off and throw some meat that was supposed to be al pastor but when i got home and took a bite out of this burrito i really really wanted it turned out to be a chicken burrito and barely cooked at that. I understand it's late and you ready to go home but if your open your customer service and food should be consistent with the quality of when you opened. I will not return heat wish i would have got her name.
author: Armoni L.

description: The burrito is aiight, but this was by far the laziness burrito wrap job I have experienced. The burrito fell apart as soon as I got home.
author: Victor S.

description: Nosy employees disregarded customers for an accident that happened outside. Super unprofessional.
author: Daniel R.

description:
I still love going to La tortilla. The women who run this place are very kind and put together a mean burrito!

Prices have not gone up. Place has been repainted and modernized a bit.

Love their Molé, green chile pork, carne asada. Having 4 different tortillas to choose from is a bonus. Food is always fresh and they don't skimp on portions.
author: Ed C.

description: $4 dollars for a taco is a bit much, but being the location, I guess it'll do. The portions of meat were pretty big and loved how they sell Caguamas.
author: Fred E. M.

description: I really think this place is kinda racist, my friend and I (Asians) came here at midnight to order food, they skipped us, started taking order from people behind us and ignored us completely. And when we came to the cashier, they accused us by us not interrupting their workers and take our order by ourselves with no apologies. It's my first bad experience having a food in California, it's suck.
author: Zachary W.

description:
Regular here, but at this moment having super quesadilla with grilled chicken......oh my, chicken pre cooked, pre grilled, no Taste........ugh

Get it together it is not that hard to grill two pieces together, especially chicken.......


Terrible, I will never come back!!!!
author: Emir L.

description:
Nope. Not worth your time or money. It may be open late (a fact clearly appreciated by the scads of hungry drunk people lined up out the door at 1AM), but that is the only thing to recommend it. The food has no flavor, the workers are rude, and they don't give you chips. At least I didn't receive any. 

I ordered rice, refried beans, pico de gallo, and a side of flour tortillas. The rice was probably the worst I've ever been served at a Mexican restaurant; it was watery and salt-free and completely tasteless. And this is coming from someone who was both starving and somewhat inebriated at the time, so I was not exactly picky. The beans were watery as well, and the "side of tortillas" were really one burrito-sized tortilla that I ended up tearing into quarters. 

I snatched some salsas (pretty sure they weren't free) thinking they might liven things up, but they did not; they were as bland as the rest of the food.

If there is anything else open in the Castro, I'd suggest you pass on La Tortilla... or hop on over to the Mission instead.
author: Ellery D.

description:
Best Mexican Food? No.
Best Service? No.
Would I come here during the day? No.

With all that being said, any place  that is open late for drunchies and doesn't serve pizza is already batting a thousand in my book. Of course there are better Mexican places out there, but if I am looking for something that is open past midnight, this place will be one of the few options in SF that serves anything but pizza. The food is also really cheap so as far as I am concerned, you get what you pay for in terms of both quality and service.

I usually get the enchiladas or the super burrito, both of which are pretty good. The restaurant setup is pretty Chipotle-like so you can choose what you're filling is for both as they are making them. The salsa is also pretty decent. They are really skimpy with the chips just fyi but if you ask, they will give you some.

I must also say that this place is not THAT bad. It is certainly not quality like I mentioned but this food is comparable to what you would get at say, Una Mas, which is better than Chipotle any day of the week.
author: Kunal N.

description: The food is underwhelming and the service leaves a lot to be desired. There are so many other options around (including Mexican cuisine) that I don't know why I'd ever come back here.
author: Pablo N.

description:
What I like about this place is that they are very consistent and you know what you are going to get. The place is on the smaller side and the line can be out the door, but they try to be as fast as they can even though there is only two people behind the counter. 

Before they could only sell sodas/beer, but now they have expanded to include wine and some liquors. The ladies behind the counter have always been very nice to me, maybe because I speak Spanish but I think is because I always say hello and thanks and treat them with respect. I've seen people treat them horrible because their English is limited and then complain about the service they get, like they please, treat them with respect, and you will be treated equally.
author: Ezekiel G.

description:
This is a pretty good, authentic, very reasonably priced Mexican taqueria in the Castro.  I've had the pleasure of eating lunch here a few times and once for dinner.   They offer free chips and salsa,  as a taqueria should,  and have a very wide selection of Mexican dishes.  

During lunch they keep a large window open to the street with outward facing stools. The service has always been very friendly and the food,  delicious.   Try the chicken tamales dinner plate, or for something to go,  they have great big burritos which they make from precooked fresh ingredients.

During dinner I noticed the crowd was mostly drunk people visiting from the bars  being obnoxious and rude to staff,  which was mildly annoying considering the employees are so nice and friendly. 

There are a multitude of fantastic options for Mexican in the city and this one rates higher than middle of the road for the price.  Better than Chipotle, not as good as many places in the mission,  but way cheaper than most places in the city. 

Great spot overall.  I like coming here because the staff is really friendly and the waiting time has always been pretty reasonable.
author: Spencer M.

description: If you're someone who would date a Mexicana so you can enjoy her mother's delicious cooking but they both end up being crazy and you no longer have access to the deliciousness...well this is the place for you! Plenty of friendly Mexican moms and delicious food that makes you want to never leave. Perfect portions and ingredients topped off with love everytime. I had the huevos a la Mexicana and it will be my go to for a while. Highly recommended if it's not clear to you yet!
author: Navi G.

description: Low key place and the food is amazing. The Azteca burrito is out of this world. Great place for after drinks food.
author: Jose R.

description: One of the cheapest places to eat in Castro, which is why I am giving it 2 stars instead of 1 because the food sucked. The beans and rice were nothing special, and the spicy chicken I got in my burrito was the worst chicken I've eaten at a restaurant. I picked it out if my burrito. It was not spicy at all, and was so dry it was hard to eat. The salsa was not spicy at all either. I would not eat here again.
author: Rebeccah M.

description:
La Tortilla has a real opportunity to gain business from the now closed Zapata Mexican Grill, which was a block away and a neighborhood favorite.  

They have not taken the challenge.  Today, I was craving a burrito.  I should have taken the time to head down to the Mission.  I'm writing this review about 3 hours after eating here and I can still taste it.  My tummy is upset and I wish I didn't eat the whole thing.  Small meat portions, bland salsas, and stale chips.
author: EC N.

description:
Stay Away Unless You Want To Be Treated Rudely!
Friday Night Found Out The Hard Way That Customer Service Here Is NOT Of Importance, After Putting In My Order From A Really Rude And Cold Woman My GirlFriend "Tried" To Order 3 Specials Listed On The Board And A Short, Stocky, Balding Man Refused To Let Her Order 3..... He Said No Only One. These Employees Do Not Take Their Job Seriously..... I Repeat Again... STAY AWAY!!!!!!!
If I Could Give This Place Zero Stars I Would.
author: Douglas G.

description:
We came here due to the fact that we were in Castro late at night and my fiance didn't want to go to the mission to get some Mexican food :/, bummer I know, however we found this place and figured, how bad can it be?

This place is a "Mexican version" of Chipotle, all the meat is already made (and it sucks),  the al pastor which was in the corner on the verical rotisserie seemed to be drier than California during the drought (pretty nasty).  Anyhow my fiance ended up getting the fajita burrito and I got the super burrito, the staff were fairly rude (and I'm usually not one to complain). Once sat we unravelled the burrito and experienced what could possibly be the worst Mexican food I have ever had, the beans were so drenched in water that the bottom of my burrito was soaked, the meat was flavorless and below subpar, the only thing this place has going for them is the size of their burritos.

If I could go back I wish I would have walked that extra half of mile to go to the mission and get some great Mexican food, so do yourself and favor and walk those extra few blocks.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
La Tortilla is a hit or miss!

My co worker and I went here for lunch and she ordered the tamales and I ordered their quesadilla. The tamales were bland and the quesadilla was just okay. One order of quesadilla is good for sharing which we liked, but I've had better! Their salsas weren't that great either.

I decided to check them out again two days later by myself and ordered the carnitas plate combo. It was really good and I liked it way better than the quesadillas.

Solid 3 STARS!
author: Glenn L.

description:
My friend introduced me to this about 8 years ago, right before I moved here. As as vegetarian, I  fell in love their tofu burritos! 

One of the best tofu burritos I have ever had to date. The tofu is marinated is some saucy goodness. I get it with the marinated nopales (cactus--so good!), black beans, rice, pico de gallo. It's amazing. 

My friends love getting their chicken super burrito, so fyi! 

If you are vegetarian, their tofu burrito is a must try. 

They are open pretty late, so if you are looking for a burrito, or some decent Mexican in the Castro after drinking hours, this also is your place!
author: Sonia A.

description:
Experiences are errrrythang! 

The cashier, cook & busboy were very rude to me & my friends. We came in late night, right before we went to go dancing, my friends ordered some drinks, one was taken/bused from the table... my friend asked for another & at first they denied him one, arguing with us that he was lying and that a stranger took it, but someone did clear his table & tray, yet they denied that. 

I wish I could have said all of us were crazy, drunk & we were over-reacting, but I actually don't drink, I'm coming from a very sober perspective.

In any case, I had the shrimp tacos and fish tacos and both were a 2. The shrimp tacos were made out of the small, frozen shrimp and riches not that good. All it had was lettuce in it. The Fish taco I had was a slab of fish & lettuce in it, as well. 

That's all I had, and that was my experience, so I'll never come back.
author: Renee R.

description:
I carry-out dinner from this place often. Very friendly, fresh, yummy and reasonable. 

I am a vegetarian and I have tried the Super Veggie burrito as well as Azetca burrito. Highly recommend it. The tofu is really good too! Price is less than $10/dish for the most part. 

They have lots of menu choices, variety of tortillas and beans. 

Comes with chips and salsa :)

Must try if you are in the neighborhood!
author: Hiral P.

description: Rude employees who don't speak a lick of English. They will overcharge you if your not Hispanic and are very racist, go somewhere else if you care about budgeting your finances, they should be closed down from the amount of customer arrive they have. Go somewhere else and save your money!!!
author: Ariana D.

description:
Tine: 6:45 pm on a Wednesday.  

This place and their staff is absolutely horrendous.    Really wish I could give negative stars, in fact i would tender remuneration to be able to give a negative rating.   It was an insult being in this restaurant on every front.

The Place
Dirty, and every single table had dirty dishes, or leftover food laying around Each table was unusable.  

The Staff
After they created our food (get to that shortly) there were five (5) staff members not doing anything.  Nothing, but standing and staring off like they were on a stare brake.   All while as mentioned above, every table was either nasty or had dirty dishes.  Literally, there were 2  tables in use and we had to buss our own to find a place to sit.   Went to ask for refills on water, and got a look like i had asked for cheese ravioli.   Bald dude at the register was an absolute fungus. 

The Food
lady who made my burrito was more interested in just about everything else than serving me... speaking to her friend,  speaking to the cashier and ignoring me.... burrito was thrown together with haste, and was cold.   Fell apart once i opened the foil. 

salsa was excellent.    dirty dishes were stacked on the salsa bar.   is this even allowable under whatever SF Health Department Standards apply?

never again, and not worth your time.  How is this place in business ?
author: Johnny C.

description:
I come here maybe once a year even though I live 4 blocks away. Their tamales have always been pretty good and they're a la carte so I can add my own salad and sides when I get it home. The rest of the menu is meh and they often get the order wrong and get mad when I correct them. 

But, had a craving for a tamal and the sign says they're a la carte. So I ask for one and she says 2 minimum. OK, I'll freeze one and don't heat it, I'll do it at home. She proceeds to put iceberg lettuce and salsa on a styrofoam containter so they add $4 for the 25 cents worth of stuff I didn't order. I tell them in Spanish "a la carta quiere decir a la carta" so he gives me attitude but takes it off the bill.  

I get home and the masa dough is heavy, which means they let the water dry out from the steamer and they re-added cold water. And instead of slow cooked shredded chicken it was big chunks of dry chicken..

I speak better Spanish than the people who work there so it wasn't about them trying to cheat the non-Spanish speakers. They are rude and try to cheat and screw everyone!
author: John G.

description:
The food at this place wasn't too bad - we got the mole. I probably shouldn't get mole and review it considering I am convinced my mom makes the best in the entire world LOL. Nonetheless it was good - better than other mole I've had here in Las Vegas. The guacamole was a little on the brown side but the tomatillo was the freshest I've EVER had. It was great. The rice and beans were a little too dry - I always had to wash it down with my beer. I wouldn't mind coming back to this place for the food - however I gave it two stars because the staff was stupidly unfriendly and no matter how good your food is, service is what always determines whether I go back or not. 

We aren't from San Francisco - we were visiting from Las Vegas, celebrating our anniversary - and the staff seemed to have no patience with us when we weren't sure what kind of beers they had or what sides came with what food. 

Won't be returning unless we absolutely want Mexican food and this is all that's around.
author: Ana A.

description:
This came highly recommended to me by a friend, & claimed you got more food & better quality, for less money than another similar restaurant down 18th street. 
Well, that's partly true. 
I ordered the "super burrito", which is the same thing I order at their competitors down the street. 
The signage is NOT very clear.  I had chosen chorizo as my carne, & it clearly upset the woman. 
She folded the burrito she'd begun in half, and made it seem like I ordered something that couldn't be made with the super burrito.  She looked flustered & not very happy at all. I started to think it was me who'd screwed up, & began to panic.  I then asked for carnitas. She then looked upset again. WTF?!?!
So I asked, "Well, what do you have??"
She gestured to the food in front of her, like I was supposed to know what was what. 
So I asked, "Can I not have the Chorizo with the super burrito?"  To which she replied, "5 minutes, because I have to cook it."
Okay, I don't have time for this shit. So carnitas it was. 
Admittedly, the burrito was huge. Really, really big. 
I wasn't given many tortilla chips, but luckily my hips don't need many either. 
I didn't notice if you could bring hot sauce home, like at my usual restaurant, but I'd asked the woman to make it hot, so I didn't think I'd need any. 
The burrito with a Mexican Coke was $13.08. 
Given that a super burrito down the street is a little over $11, this is a very good price. 
In the end, the burrito was bland. The meat was bland & chewy. Plus, it wasn't spicy at all. 
A complete waste.  
I'd started this review with 2 stars, but as I was writing it, I remembered how stupid that lady made me feel, & decidedly changed it to 1 star. 
I don't care if the burrito is huge & $2 cheaper than down the street. 
I should've checked Yelp first. This place is a bust. I won't be going back. And I'll stop balking at spending $2 more when it's worth it. 
This place is NOT worth it. Pass it by, & walk to 18th & Collingwood.
author: Reed S.

description:
You know you've got a problem when a taqueria has bad guacamole. Red flag! Red flag!

I ordered the Tofu Ranchero burrito, remembering having enjoyed one months and months ago when I had finished up my drinking in the Castro. Tonight, it seemed super bland and not as yummy as the last time.

Okay, first things first... I truly and wholeheartedly empathize with the staff. They have to deal with drunk, annoying people all night long, but the quality of the food was really poor. I ordered a side of chips and guac. $2 extra for chips? Come on! Those should be free. If you add a container of guacamole, it's a whopping $6.50 extra. I spent over $15 total (plus a dollar tip, even though the staff wasn't very pleasant).

This is quite literally some of the worst guacamole I have ever had. It tasted like someone spilled a pitcher of water in it, and instead of throwing it away, decided to simply mix it all together. What a bland, disgusting mess. It kept falling off the chip, it was so thin and watery. I ate a couple of bites and gave up. 

The burrito itself was pretty boring. Rice, refried beans, tofu... that's it. Where was my salsa, as promised on the menu? I ordered spicy salsa and did not get any salsa at all. I had to drown it in my own personal bottle of hot sauce just to give it any sort of flavor. 

I rarely write scathingly bad reviews these days, but this place really deserves it. I feel like I got ripped off. The late night burrito is a sacred thing. It helps you regain sanity after a long night of boozing and help fend off any hangovers or puking episodes in the middle of the night. I quite literally should have gone to a Taco Bell, because at least I would have spent half as much on food of the same caliber. 

I may be a white girl (half white, at least), but I know good Mexican food. I spent my first seven years in Long Beach, devouring bean and cheese burritos from a tiny shack of a taqueria since I could eat solids. I'm no expert, but this place should be ashamed. I want my $15 back, but it's lost and gone forever. Next time, I'll just go to Walgreens and get a cup o' noodles or something. Ugh.
author: Brandi W.

description: Omg!!! The cashier who is at the moment is so angry, you need change by one person always is smiling.... thanks...
author: Vidal D.

description:
I like the food here it's decent and cheap 

But I was horrified when the woman was making my burrito 

When I came in she was cleaning with a dirty rag 
And then didn't change her gloves to make my burrito 

And the other woman was counting the money and then kept the same gloves on to make someone else's burrito 

And I'm just sitting here watching them do a bunch of other stuff with the same gloves...I can't image how long they keep the same pair on
author: Kyle J.

description: An ok burrito place when you're starving and need a place open late. The burrito I got was large though slightly expensive it seemed. Regrettably the meat was flavorless and their salsa didn't help much; might return if I was in the area late at night and needed food quickly.
author: Frank L.

description:
We've actually been here several times over my Yelp years; usually before or after a Sing-a-Long at the Castro Theatre.  

After BARTing and MUNI-ing over we had just enough time to grab a quick bite before our movie started. We were lucky to place our order before the line started growing.

I got a Chicken Fajita Burrito--with pinto beans, rice, grilled chicken and grilled onions and peppers. I added cilantro, onions and salsa. A little messy to eat since  there wasn't much filling and iasrt wasn't rolled tightly and wasn't wrapped in foil or paper. 
I seem to recall the burritos being bigger on earlier visits.

Mr Rinky wanted to get a veggie burrito but they ran out of vegetables (other than onions, peppers) except for broccoli--so he had a broccoli,bean, rice burrito on a whole wheat tortilla. He said it was okay.

Not sure if we'll eat there again next time we're in the Castro.I guess we're spoiled by the places in Richmond or our SF and San Mateo fave, Pancho Villa.
author: Rinky N.

description:
Wow!  The workers here are unhappy.  Obviously, sullenly unhappy. Unhappy to the point of hostility to customers.

We have been eating lighter so going in for our old normal take-out order of heavy Mexican food should have been a treat.  But, when we placed our order there was a real lack of acknowledgement or connection by the staff supposedly making what we ordered.I didn't get the feel that what we wanted was understood or was going to be made.  I let my husband do the ordering, because he's better at ignoring disinterest.  I went on to the cashier to pay.

My attempt at small talk with the male cashier was a disastrous failure.  Dead eyes.

Then the bill was higher than it used to be. Okay, it's been a while.  But, I wanted to know how  came to be that high (it was only $30)... what were the prices of the things we ordered.  I was questioning, not challenging.  But, the cashier actually said no, I had to pay first before he'd break down the bill.

That was it.  We left the food and went down the street to get our takeout.  

The restaurant had only a couple people in it at prime eating time, no line.  It really felt like with the hostility and lack of diners that this place is on borrowed time.  Too bad... it used to be our favorite.
author: Galen W.

description:
The place is for people that are looking for something delicious and fast. It is a Taqueria that does not have ambiance but it does not need it when you are hungry and value a delicious well prepared meal.
 Wide good selection of ingredients available. They have a delicious chocolate mole that I can't get tired of eating. The el pastor tacos that are always so good and veggie scrambled  for the picky vegetarian. Needless to say the people that works there are humble and friendly, every time they make me feel welcome. Definitely our favorite spot in Castro.
author: Kristyna M.

description:
Terrible. 

Their burritos are absolutely awful, with dry rice, undercooked beans, and (for my selection) unseasoned grilled chicken.

I have thought about how shitty their food is and how they manage to stay in business. The only thing I can figure is that they have enough tourists coming through (who wouldn't be back anyway) to support them.

It is a tragedy that they exist.
author: N'olo J.

description: Worst place in the castro... im half nicaraguense and they thought i didnt know spanish and were calling me a faggot without any confrontation... just tried eating again and the lady was saying how annoyed she was "she has to deal with US"... homophobic and very rude... I'm an extremely nice person and I'm just put of words to express how a place filled with this much hate could be in this neighborhood... I hope they find peace within themselves and stop the hate.. if that doesn'tt happen I really hope they're replaced with a business that loves us.
author: Shane S.

description:
I just left this place today on 06/15/2016 and I use to like it until I realize my bank card went missing after making a purchase and eating in there. Typically if a person forgot their card at the register tou would think the people working there would let you know left it behind if you sticking around their place to eat. I left realizing my card was missing and an extra 13 dollar charge was added to my account.

 When I went back they said they did not have my card and someone could have taken it a made charge but my picture was on the debit card.
The cashier made and offer to take the extra charge off when I told him to do so he made another about him having close his register to do that. I already blocked the card. I will not be returning back this place. I really needed that money to get to work the next few days before my next pay check.
author: Ernest W.

description:
I hadn't gone here in a few years but I really crave their tofu meals so I gave them another chance. I went twice and everything was fine. But the next time, I saw the woman handling raw shrimp, and then she came over and put her bare unwashed hand in the bag of tortillas and asked me what I wanted. I said "Did you wash your hands?" and she said "What?" I again said "You touched raw shrimp, did you wash your hands after?" and she looked confused and said "What kind of tortilla you want?"

I just walked away. I don't understand what THEY dont understand about cleanliness & cross contamination?!
author: Venus S.

description: If I could give this place no stars I would. Reason being is that I found multiple shards of bones in my burrito. I also ordered a super burrito, got charged for a burrito, and got a plain burrito. When I called to let them know about the situation, the woman on the phone did not show any concern or was even apologetic. I made the suggestion to not serve that meat in particular since it was very so a choking hazard.
author: Raine M.

description:
My favorite thing to eat late at night and when Im drunk is Mexican food. 

I came here late at night with my friends. We got the asada burrito...it was okay..salsa wasn't that spicy and flavorful; and yes that's important to me. IT was over $10 bucks for a burrito...

My favorite Mexican food spot in SF is still El Farolito hands down.
author: Phuong K.

description:
Never has a place upset me enough to leave a review but whelp, la tortilla has done it. I mean, where do I even start? It's amazing how they manage to make their food both disgusting and flavorless. Add a little salt, just a little once in a while. Or is that too much to ask for? Maybe you could use the 60 cents you're charging people for salsa cups to buy some salt. Also, seriously dude? How dare you charge me 60 cents for a small salsa cup. And these aren't even the normal size small salsa cups you get from a Mexican restaurant too, they're smaller. I would never pay half a dollar for your terrible salsa. It's not like I can't afford it but on principle I'm not doing that. I just went across the street and bought Cholula at Walgreens instead. Honestly though it breaks my heart to leave this review because I fully support small businesses, and I understand it's hard in this crazy expensive city but this place just sucks. I miss la Zapata. 

Thanks yelp for letting me leave this review. It was really cathartic. I feel better now.
author: J. Ashley C.

description: I wanted to try the breakfast burrito with chorizo but they were out of chorizo but I ended up getting two chicken Aztec tacos which were good the chips were ok I think a little stale but love the grilled onions and bell peppers were done to perfection
author: Lorena D.

description:
I've lived in SF for many many years on and off.

Your staff must be jaded. The last time I was there they were just expecting my money. Their attitudes suck. I work with US public in Government and Restaurant and can understand people can be much especially when they are drunk.

I have always been polite, spent a lot of money at your restaurant and have recommended people there.

I will never go back. Your restaurant is ok for takeout. For takeout service a -10. Awfull service. No apology for being out of products. 

Most of all remember Xmas season about happiness. So it's this day it happened around 2am. Get rid of them or help them change their attitudes. We can help you close sooner than you think.
author: Michael K.

description: La Tortilla is located right on Castro Street,  which is great for people watching. They serve standard Mexican food that is made to order and fast. I like that they have a couple different varieties of Mexican beer to go with whatever you're having, because there's no better pairing for a burrito than beer. Their burritos are large and I enjoyed it much better than the fish and shrimp tacos.
author: Monica V.

description: Came here for the first time today. Ordered a burrito and two tacos. My brother loved the burrito, I loved my steak taco and my cousin loved her shrimp taco. Big portions, the staff was nice and helpful. I will definitely be coming back! Oh, my brother had a chorizo and egg burrito.
author: Janet P.

description: Came here after a night out in Castro. I had the breakfast burrito with chorizo. It's not your typical, authentic taqueria you'd find in Mission, but for $7 you get a huge burrito....and they're open late! They moved pretty quick, too.
author: Rob M.

description: Standard Mexican fare that's pretty cheap too. Not bad for a quick stop if you're super early for an event at the theater or if you're in the neighborhood and just want something quick and casual. The offerings are pretty average, and they're prepared pretty quickly. Perfectly average.
author: Vincent L.

description: I came here because I was desperately craving Mexican food after a gym session, and I had never tried this place before. Coming to La Tortilla made me crave Taco Bell. Seriously. Worst Mexican food I have ever had. I mean, sure the place is clean, the menu has variety, and the service is decent. My friend and I ordered tacos and horchata. Both were mediocre. The meat was flavorless, and the horchata tasted artificial. Would not recommend, even if you are horrendously drunk!!
author: Stefanie C.

description: This place is awesome! I been coming for well over 4 yrs and they always have been so nice to me. The food is inexpensive and fast, and they r super delicious. I love their Super Taco, they r big enough that i only need one. Well... Maybe because Imm a small portion eater.
author: Thyra K.

description: This place doesn't even deserve a star, the worst burrito ever. Reheated carne asada, no taste, after my burrito was wrapped they put in the microwave to appear hot. Guacamole? not made in house, they buy it at supermarket and sell it for $7 a bowl, fajita veggies? from frozen bags. Tortilla and chips? from the supermarket. Salsa was horrible, I also got an upset stomach after the whole order. Whoever eats here is either drunk or has no clue what Mexican food tastes like. The health department needs to check this place out. My question is: why did you actually make freah asada for the guy that ordered an asada plate? You put reheated old meat in burritos because it mixed and it harder to taste the meat? You are a shame for la rasa. I feel ripped off, the worst $30 ever spent
author: Alexandru D.

description:
It just occurred to me that it can be really hit-or-miss at La Tortilla. When it's empty, it's definitely a miss. 

Stopped by one weekday afternoon and the place was practically empty. Perhaps that explained the lassez faire attitude of the staff. I think they don't make fresh food till later in the day for the dinner crowd because my order of carnitas tacos looked really sad. The carnitas looked like it was from the day before and lacked the crispy fried texture. What made it worse was the sheer amount of liquid from the meat and black beans that formed a "moat" on the plate. It made the tortilla fall apart instantly and eating it with your hands impossible. All in all, it was an unsatisfying meal. 

La Tortilla, you can do better than that please. And on that note, so can I and thus it's off to Zapata's from now on if I need a taco in the Stro.
author: Jon L.

description: In one word: Terrible. I read a couple reviews saying that this place has "good tacos". OMG, the food is a joke, totally tasteless and looks no hygienic. I would love upload the pic of my guacamole and chips. The guacamole looks very nasty with a brown color. Taco was dry. Really, if you are a really Mexican food lover, avoid this place.
author: Carla P.

description:
Veggie Nightmare!!!! I ordered the mushroom quesadilla and I got half way through it and there was a small amount of chopped chicken.... seriously, they might as well have pooped on the plate. I was so nauseated and the people that work there had no remorse. 

The woman said she would make another for me but I ate less than half of the last one and I was sick from the chicken in it.... thanks a lot. I just walked out,,. this place has gone way down hill.
author: Scott K.

description: Good like always, my quesadillas with corn tortilla, mushrooms and cheese ate so good!! No greasy and generous amount of cheese and mushrooms. Only one critique, is a new guys here, checking the amount of everything. The difference is just a little. I don't know if they are trying to reduce the budget but this practice in Castro, area full of rich and class media bitches is not good!!
author: Arturo R.

description: If someone orders a tofu taco, and there is no serving spoon in the tofu, get a clean spoon. You CAN NOT grab the spoon from the chicken and just shake it off.
author: David B.

description: The second worst meal I have had and the first one was here last week. I thought I would try something else today, I did it was just as bad not only that I was served the left overs while the people in front of me were served right off the grill.
author: Tom W.

description:
Mediocre food, I know taco trucks with better tasting food. Best suited for people both who are unfamiliar with the cuisine  it's supposed to be,  have bland taste or thinner wallet by Castro standards. 
It's also a joke that they charge 5 dollars for a regular sized domestic beer.  Given that they are on the cheaper side of Castro it feels that unwilling regulars keep it afloat.
author: J Angel G.

description:
Worst food ever. Everyone in my party couldn't eat the food and walked out to go somewhere else. Food is tasteless, people behind the counter are incredibly incompetent, and the place is typically empty. That should have been a dead giveaway that we should have eaten elsewhere. 

Don't waste your time, money or calorie intake here.
author: T L.

description: I'm a regular at La tortilla , the crew is really fast making the food and also very nice for dealing with drunk people a lot of the time they must be very patient. Is the only place you can eat after hours at The castro after Partying or Working .
author: Simon B.

description:
Quick and easy, this place was good for a post-party meal.

I got the steak taco and Matt B. got the chicken taco... and I have to say the chicken taco was way better because while my steak taco was tough and dry, the chicken taco was tender, juicy and flavorful.

They have a few salsa selections, but nothing too impressive.
author: Peggy S.

description:
You served me rancid pico de gallo that I didn't realize until the end of the burrito. As a result, I vomited all night, threw out my back from the convulsions and then when I call you to discuss, you refuse to speak to me and hang up over and over. 

You are 1) dangerous 2) egregiously unappreciative of your customers and 3) illegally encroaching on my right to bacteria-free food. 

Just wait and see how bad this gets for your business after refusing to even discuss the food you served me. You wouldn't even allow for a basic exchange of information. I hope you lose your business. I'd give zero stars if possible. You're the worst ever.
author: Jason F.

description: I like it here. You can tell the beans are fresh and the food comes out hot! I had the asada taco with horchata. Their horchata is bomb!!!
author: Angel G.

description: This place overcharges like crazy. If you go late at night on a weekend they will assume you are drunk and will overcharge because they don't think you'll notice. This has happened to us on more than a few occasions. Doesn't matter how good the food is, we will not be coming back here again. Shady business going on.
author: Stephanie A.

description: This is one of the worst Mexican food places I've ever eaten at. Reminds me of Taco Bell. Very crappy service, tasteless non authentic flavor. I grew up on authentic Mexican food living in AZ and NM. This place really needs to shut down. Go to TacoOrgasmico on market! It has a down home famila vibe with real authentic Mexican food. The only good Mexican restaurant in the Castro. Again boycott this place they are awful!
author: gayle w.

description:
I don't understand the less-than-four-star reviews. Those people are crazy. This is the BEST taqueria in San Francisco. Good quality meat, healthy brown rice, and their chicken mole is some of the best... better than most sit down Mexican restaurants. 

The service isn't as good as it used to be since the guy who used to manage it isn't there anymore... but the food still wins.
author: Josh A.

description: We have gone here before and they are RUDE. the man at the front is insanely rude. We were in line and he took the next customer before us. When it was our turn and we said "burrito and chips" he demanded us to say please. I cannot stand this and will always for now end up next store. This place needs mannors and hospitality for their zip code. Please Don't support a business who treats their customers like that. Not fair.
author: Danny B.

description: My favorite burrito place in the city! Alesia (sp?) always makes me the best wet bean burrito. I don't eat meat or dairy and I am always stuffed after one of their burritos. *if I can finish the whole thing in one sitting!* Yelp needs to update their hours though, they are open to 2 am everyday, I believe? Working in the service industry, it's nice to know I can grab a good quality burrito on my way home from work after a long night of serving food to others. I go there a little too much but, I'm definitely not complaining ;)
author: Gianna B.

description:
This place has had multiple health inspection violations and they are all up for view if you check online. I will never be back. 

I urge you not to come here if you value your digestive system, do not want to get severe food poisoning or have any kind of germ phobias.
author: Bianca U.

description: The Nachos were ok, but they charged me $3.38 for a Jarritos.  I couldn't even change my mind because the cashier popped the top.  $3.38 for 12 ounces of flat soda.  The nachos could be amazing but I can't tell, my mind keeps going back to $3.38,
author: Jay D.

description: Meh. Chipotle is better. The Azteca burrito is large but a big gooey mess. Also, the cashier behind the counter hates her job. I've seen that disgruntled look before, coupled with the fact that she doesn't give a hoot about customer service.
author: Kenson K.

description: The tables/eating area could have been cleaner but were not filthy either.  The price seemed appropriate for the quality and they are apparently open late which made for a long line at around 2 am.  Fortunately, we had eaten there earlier in the night when things were less crowded.
author: James H.

description: So I've eaten here a few times. Trying to be objective about it, the food isn't bad. But today I went in to get a taco and bit into what I thought must have been a chicken bone...nope, much to my surprise, it was a razor blade about 3 inches long. I kid you not. I went back and returned the food and was given no explanation what so ever, as the two women just spoke to each other as if I wasn't there. I did speak to someone on the phone briefly who I couldn't understand. I think at first I was just in shock, but after sitting on it for a minute, I'm pretty fucking pissed. They did apologize and gave my money back, but Christ, a razor blade? I thought that stuff only happened in urban legends. If you're gonna eat here..you might die. Awaiting some explanation and proper apology.
author: Donny N.

description:
Decent food and great prices. 
I had the breakfast burrito with chorizo and it was pretty good. It was $6 for one burrito and they're pretty filling. It's far from an authentic taqueria, but it's definitely not a Chipotle. The horchata was pretty good, too, but not the best. There's plenty of seating, but it might be a tad crowded on a Friday or Saturday night. I've been here twice and the first time the service was good, the second time it was just alright. I'd recommend this place to other people if they're in the neighborhood.
author: Cesar S.

description: Had this after a night at the bars. The steak azteca tacos were cooked fresh to order and really delicious and sizeable. At $4 a piece was a great deal
author: adam a.

description:
To put it simply, La Tortilla is only good when you're drunk. 

Whenever I was in the Castro and needed a quick bite to help sober myself up, La Tortilla was a good place to turn to. The food was decent, the service was quick, it was opened late, and overall, it was very convenient. La Tortilla on a sober day, is a disappointment. Coming from LA, I knew that I should not expect anything great about Mexican food in San Francisco, but food at La Tortilla is crap even by San Francisco standards.

Yes, the food here is relatively cheap compared to other restaurants in the Castro, but it's not worth it because the food is so bland!! The meat is bland, the beans are bland, everything is bland! 

If you are looking for a nice meal, do NOT go to La Tortilla. 

If you are looking for a filling meal because you're hungry, drunk and/or desperate, La Tortilla is a good place for you.
author: Mark B.

description:
The food was ok, but the staff was awful, especially the male cashier.  Certainly that was true last evening.   I have eaten here in the afternoon, and found it to be just fine, but yesterday evening it was obvious that the male staff was deliberately giving out tiny portions and overcharging for the food.  I wonder if the owner is aware of how openly the staff is ripping off the customers.  They seemed to enjoy getting over on people.
Go to Zapatas instead, one block away.  Not cheaper, but more bang for the buck, with friendly, HONEST staffers.
author: Nina G.

description:
Food is pretty good. They have lots of options. It is a bit pricey though for a burrito. There nice sized burritos though. I did run into an issue when I came in last week on Tuesday.
 I asked for a rootbeer from their fountain sodas and it tasted like toilet water. I've never had soda taste that way before. It was the worst taste ever it was like numbing. It made the food hard to eat and was a waste of 2 dollars. Like I said though the food is good but the drink tasting like that definitely makes me unsure of this place.
author: Veronica B.

description: I don't get why is this place has only 3 star rating. They have freshly made breakfast burrito, the staff is friendly and their food is delicious. I'm having my chicken mole burrito and thinking if I could get this at any other Mexican food place in the city - no - so I would call this hole in the wall a one of a kind taqueria with great flavors and quick serving. Please do not compare this place to your fancy-pantsuit Mexican restaurants in the city with $20 dishes and freshly made margaritas. If that's what you looking for then stay away from this place.
author: Francesca L.

description: La Tortilla is a-ok. Not a totally Castro-ized eatery, although they do have tortillas in a few shades represented in the rainbow. The joint is a nice representation of diversity and likely a reliably fast and filling food fixture for the Castro dwellers.  Not much to compel a return visit, but kinda nice to know it is there...like knowing there is a fire extinguisher in a cabinet in my kitchen... but hope to never have to use it. Had a carnitas plato, not terrible, but in comparison to joints in da Mission it didn't quite stand up to my carnitas carnal craving.
author: Matsuo U.

description:
Goodbye La Tortilla. I have been a regular for years, but today you absolutely blew it.

I gave my order to the lady behind the counter. She was just finishing up the person in front of me. A minute later another customer came in behind me. The employee asked that customer what she would like, and then proceeded to put her order together. Seriously, nachos and 3 burritos. I had ordered just one item for myself. I tried to make eye contact with the employee as she rushed around preparing the other patron's food. I looked over at the cashier (who just put his hands up like "I dunno") and then I walked out. 

I'm sure you'll do fine La Tortilla, if nothing else from bar patrons looking to sober up late at night. But you've lost my business. I will walk the extra block to get to another taqueria in the neighborhood. There's no way I'm going to tolerate rudeness. Bye-bye!
author: Tim G.

description: So we walk in and see the awesome menu with all the vegetarians options and decent prices etc etc. We were never greeted over a period of 5 minutes, just totally ignored! We moved more to the front of the line thinking ok maybe we order here? Bit#%y woman behind counter tells us to go to end of the line, which is where we were and ignored for 5 min. We go back to the end of line and they let some guy they seemed very chummy with cut in front of us!!! I said the hell with this and we left. We will Never will return here again!!!
author: Clark P.

description:
Look how many 1 star reviews this place has before going...I wish I had. I've never even seen a place with this many 1 stars..!!

   Worst restaurant experience I've ever had. The place is so small people will bump into you and literally step on your toes the entire time. The lady making the food asked me about 5 times what I wanted. She was attempting to multi task so she would go do something and then come back and ask me what I wanted and then go do something else and then go back and ask me what i wanted..then when I went to the register the woman making the food told the cashier what I ordered but it was wrong so for the 6th time I had tell them what I wanted. I asked for it to go but they did not make it to go so when they handed me my food I asked for a box. I sat down and tried to put the tacos in the box but they were so wet that they just fell apart so I left the pile of slop on the table and walked out. Oh and they also charged 18 dollars for THREE TACOS..!!! Yes. 18 dollars!!!!! Wtf.!? I got COMPLETELY screwed and I had to go to work so now I have no dinner...an 8 hour shift and no dinner. Smh.
author: Jeremy H.

description: Hands down worst tacos I have ever eaten. The chicken was burned. The beef tasted gamey. The pork was one big chunk of congealed fat. No seasoning. No salsa. The tacos consisted only of stale tortillas, meat, refried beans from a can and a few specks of mushy tomato. Disgusting!
author: Gianna S.

description:
Ambiance:  It's a hole in the wall.  You won't come here for the ambiance.  You'll come here for the food.  "Nuff said.

Service:  Friendly, but based on above, you won't expect much.  They're nice, so be nice to them. :)

Food:  Pretty good.  You could get a burrito, sure -- I have, and they're good for a post-drinking session.  However, I suggest the regular tacos.  They're as good as anything you'd get off of a taco truck, and perhaps just as cheap.  The upside to this place over said taco truck?  You get free chips, free salsa, and you get a place to sit/utensils to use.  This, in my mind, makes this place better than a taco truck, given that I find that the food is just as delicious.

I have attached two pictures which I think exemplify just how generous the workers at La Tortilla are with their servings.  Take a look and then stop in!  You'll leave happy and you'll help a neighborhood business at the same time.
author: Bryan H.

description: I was visiting sf (which i dont do very often)...i was looking for a well priced good atmosphere restaurant.. Then i saw it " La Tortilla" i love mexican food and decided to try it i had the super burrito with asada and a snapple tea the price was very reasonable and extremely nice. The woman who helped me was kind and she looked like she wanted to help me with my order. I give 5 stars for good quality food, amazing atmosphere, and outstanding customer service skills....keep up the good work u guys
author: James M.

description:
A decent taqueria for the Castro, but this place wouldn't fly in the Mission. Unless you're looking for a quick meal or can't fathom a 10 minute walk, you'll find better options east of Guerrero.

I had their super burrito. As far as super burritos go in SF, it was fine. There wasn't anything amazing, but it also wasn't lacking the essentials. That is probably true for the rest of their menu.

They accept credit too.
author: Andrew H.

description:
This is one of the friendliest and quickest food joints in the Castro. Their vegan/vegetarian options are delicious (steamed broccoli burrito anyone?) and the atmosphere is part of the fun. 

The salsa bar could use some help, but hey, I love it anyway!
author: Stephen H.

description:
Glowering woman at the cash register only said one thing to me, gruffly: "for here?" "Yes." She made it to go. 

Also, they were out of what I wanted, but the food tasted fine.
author: Brandon M.

description:
This place is gross.  The food is BLAND and TASTELESS, it's some of the worst Mole I have ever eaten, and speaking of eating, they overfill their tacos so that you cannot pick them up to eat them.  You have to eat the beans/rice/meat with a spoon and then you're left with a soggy, wet, nasty mess of a corn-tortilla garnish.

Yuck.  Especially when you're in the castro trying to get some dick.  Who wants to fuck around with someone who has taco all over their hands (and possibly face)?

Details, people. Details.
author: Michael D.

description: I asked for a pork tamale and got a sweet corn with raisins instead. Very upset that employees didn't bother doing their jobs and checking.
author: Alex N.

description:
The ladies behind the counter are friendly and remind me of being at home in my grandmother's kitchen. When I first moved to San Francisco from Texas, I could take odd comfort in a late-night visit to La Tortilla to experience the sounds, smells and warmth of my family's kitchen back home. 

It seems that most of the negative reviews of this place stem from patrons not realizing what they are walking into. 

This IS NOT a gourmet restaurant. 
This IS NOT highly seasoned Tex-Mex. 
This IS NOT $20 a plate Mexican food.
This IS NOT bite-sized morsels.

La Tortilla IS unapologetically large portions of simple, filling food. I can eat here, be completely full and have leftovers on a $4.95 Nopalito Breakfast Burrito. If you are looking for an inexpensive meal, this is your place. I personally always go for the Breakfast Menu because it is truly he best value for your buck. The Burritos and Tacos are full to bursting, so prepare to eat them with a spoon and fork. While Beef and Chicken portions are Pre-Cooked (but still cooked in house) Breafast items are cooked to order. 

For Vegetarians, the Nopalito or Mushroom Breakfast Burrito are perfect. For Vegans...not so much. You'll want to dine elsewhere.
author: Andrew D.

description:
Reading the other reviews for this place makes me laugh.  If you are A. a vegetarian, B. have gluten, soy or other allergies, or C. are an entitled bitch, DO NOT EAT HERE!  You will likely be disappointed.  In fact, why do you even eat Mexican food in the first place, other than to have something to complain about later?

That said, I love this place and have been coming here for over a decade.  My favorite burrito in San Francisco is their ham and egg breakfast burrito which only used to be available until 3pm but is now available all day and night!  My partner loves the nopales burrito.  Their fresh, homemade salsa is really tasty and not ever too hot to handle.

The ladies who work here are all so very nice and friendly.  If you don't like their service I'm guessing you're a grumpus because I have never had bad service at this place.

They always ask if you want chips (no extra charge) and their horchata is pretty good too.  Is this the best Mexican restaurant on the planet?  No.  Is it perfect place to fill your gullet with some solid Mexican food that won't burn your insides while bar hopping?  Yes!
author: Jon B.

description:
Came here with a bunch drunk fools, they all thought it was good but unfortunately for me, I wasn't on the same level as them. We had three burritos, I tried two which consisted of one being bbq pork and a chicken one. The bbq pork one had some odd peas and carrots in it.. which is strange because I have never had a burrito with those items in it. It was just weird... and I guess a bit nasty in a sense since it did seem to be from frozen. Both burritos were a bit bland but the chicken one stood out to be the most bland burrito I've ever had.. even worse than Papalotes.
I'd probably never go back.... unless we find ourselves in a drunken state in the Castro.
author: Tiff C.

description: I think this place is okay if you are desperate for Mexican food and need your fix if you are on Castro street.  Their burritos are pretty mediocre...I had a chicken mole plate that was alright and arrived as a big portion.
author: Ken G.

description:
Love this place. I go here at least once a week. The meat is good and everything really taste amazing. I'm pretty selective and health conscious when it comes to meats, salsa and beans. I think they definitely have it down! 

I recommend the super burrito and enchiladas!
author: Nicki W.

description: Say what you want about the Mission having the best, most authentic Mexican food, but La Tortilla in the heart of the Castro has pretty good food and is inexpensive. They have, hands down, the best veggie burrito I've ever had. I think it has to do with their black beans and rice. Something about it is so flavorful. I get cheese and spicy salsa in mine as well, and it comes with free chips. I mostly come here after a night of drinking because of it's convenient location. I'm not so sure I'd come here for a sit down meal just because it's a tiny place and is usually filled with annoying, loud drunk people.
author: John L.

description: Ahh... La Tortilla. How I love you. This place is open late, food is delicious and the staff are super nice. I go here weekly and they never disappoint. If you do your best to order in Spanish they are extra sweet you too :) Thank you guys for the many delicious plates of nachos and tacos!
author: Rory F.

description: Live these girls. They always make great food and are funny as hell. I always get the tostada salad or quesadilla. Love there spicy salsa.
author: Bill N.

description: I used to like this place a lot because the people there were very nice regardless drunk or not, am or pm. They were just nice and  kind to costumers... Also very clean when making food. I gave this place two more chances after going there for years. Last time the people there were soooo RUDE to my friend that I felt it was unfair because at the end of the day, we're all paying costumers. Last time, NEVER AGAIN (go back there) I ordered fajita steak burrito and the lady repeated my ordered, I thought she got it. Later on refused to make my order after saying I ordered a Giant Super Burrito. I inquired her politely about my order and she was super mean and said that I ordered that and I have to pay for it because that's what I asked for...I still paid for the meal, gave it to a homeless person who would appreciate that giant meal. It's just dissapointing to pay for something you didn't order and you're pushed to pay for a meal you won't enjoy a single bite.
author: Annel K.

description: I come here to eat one thing and that is their chicken quesadilla. I love that. The reason behind the one star is because the rude customer service I received at 3AM on August 1, 2015. Look I get it. It's closing and you aren't serving food any more. But you don't have to be a cold heart person, and give me huge amounts of attitude to tell me "NO MO FOOD."
author: Vinson H.

description: $23 for two tacos and one beer. The tacos were mediocre (salsas were good) and the staff spoke to me only in Spanish despite me only speaking back in English. The prices for the two tacos ($4.30 each) and one beer ($5) shouldn't have come out to the $23 that showed up on my credit card bill. Hard to argue over a bill when the people are only speaking Spanish
author: Victoria W.

description:
Another instance of, "Wow, I'm wasted and stuffing my face in your food, but it is...really  not good." Confirmed it by coming in sober in the morning while waiting on the good people at Magnet to touch me. Chorizo egg breakfast burrito. There is so much goodness in that four-word utterance that it was sad to see that somehow La Tortilla succeeded in making it not so tasty. 

I guess it's my fault, if I want a burrito, imma walk into the Mission.
author: Kevin L.

description: Not bad food. Not the best of San Francisco. The wife said the food taste very average, not bad but simply average. It wasn't awful though still tasty.
author: Matthew F.

description: Ok, I don't know if I was just intoxicated, or if this was the best burrito of my life. Judging by this place's Yelp score, maybe it was the former. Regardless, this place hit the spot and made me fall in love with burritos all over again.
author: William H.

description: Decent prices, open late, good atmosphere. Really bland food and really bad service if you don't speak Spanish.
author: SF R.

description:
If my smart phone weren't dead, I would've Yelped of course to inform my lunch decision. Alas, it was and I didn't so I had a very tasteless burrito at La Tortilla.

Why was it so tasteless? It seems impossible it could possibly be with all the ingredients: I got the super burrito with everything including pork carnitas, guac, black beans, (mild) salsa, cheese. It was just so bland. I salted the hell out of it to no avail, looking for any flavor.

They get 2 stars instead of 1 because the ladies behind the counter were very polite as well as efficient. That said, they'd just served one customer and no one else was in line behind me as it was early, like 11:15 on a Friday morning. 

Disappointing..
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Popped into this place I had walked past a hundred times. It was pretty much what I expected. Basic Mexican fare, nothing spectacular but it was tasty enough and not priced badly.

With the Mission area so close, I can't imagine intentionally seeking this place out for Mexican food, but honestly, if I'm in the neighborhood and really in the mood for a burrito, I'd pop back in. A solid three-star experience.
author: Sean B.

description: The food here is decent, I usually get the Super Taco cause I love guacamole. I think the best part about the place is the price when compared to every other place you could eat in the Castro. This place is cheap and the food quality is pretty good when considering that fact.
author: Bryan M.

description: pretty terrible tasting mexican food across the board.  space is not very inviting or well utilized.  Don't get the Horchata.  Mine tasted like a melted banana laffy taffy mixed with a bunch of sugar and stale water.  ugh, will not be returning.
author: Ernie A.

description:
DO NOT COME HERE.

If Yelp could even create a negative star, this place deserves it! 

I came in happily ordering a chorizo breakfast burrito. The server then takes another order from person behind me, then sees her friend and takes and makes his order first. 

When the customer behind me complains, this Puta had the nerve to wave her finger at her face and said "in a minute". 

Anyway, THEIR FOOD IS EDIBLE ONLY WHEN YOU'RE DRUNK. I only dropped by because I did not want to walk an extra block to Zapatas, which I did in the end. Its pathetic here and I think they know that. 

THATS RIGHT, OWN YOUR MEDIOCRITY! Don't waste your time or money. If you are a smart business owner, you'd weed out this Puta quick.
author: Thomas L.

description: Stopped by to have a drink with some family.  We ordered the Super Nachos, they're ok.  It's not super authentic, but it was still a decent option.  I would have to try something else other than just Nachos to give them a higher rating.
author: Orlando V.

description: Came in and ordered a super taco the other night on my lunch break. Can honestly say it was the best super taco I've had so far. The staff is very friendly and the establishment looks clean. Awesome experience!
author: Jose G.

description: They kicked us out because "thy were  closed" although we had ordered our food and had to eat outside  (???). Their food is good, but it doesn't give them the right to kick us out of the place, does it?
author: Anderson A.

description:
Panhandlers, pigeons, and pathetic sauces to name a few. 

When I stepped-in and attempted to place my order, the server was bent on rushing me over to the counter than actually taking the details of my request.  I had to repeat my request for a super veggie burrito twice.  Afterwards, I had to halt him before he could spoil my order with black beans.  In any other taqueria  throughout the City, servers ask you why type of beans / salsa you'd like.  Here, its like they apply the preference of the last patron to that of the next in the interest of expediency.   

Next is the general philosophy that the farther away a taqueria is from the Mission District, the crummier their quality of ingredients.  La Tortilla validates this philosophy.  Their salsas are watery, their guacamole is heavily salted, and their other fresh ingredients like lettuce, etc. taste like they've been aging in the fridge.  

Lastly there is the dining environment.  With a building structure that facing the sidewalk, it invites fresh air and daylight from its open bay window.  It also serves as an open door for pigeons.  During my visit, one pigeon kept walking in and out casually without interruption from the cashier or anyone behind the counter.  Even when the bird decided to fly up and around for attention, not a single staff member moved to shoo it away.  I don't recall dining in to mean sharing with local rats with wings.  

As if the rat with wings wasn't bad enough, there are the panhandlers.  Its the Castro so there are bound to be some.  One walked in casually with 3 pens in hand.  He approached each patron dining inside in attempts to pedal the pens.  Nods and 'No thank you's were all he got.  This guy wasn't invisible and there was no place to hide in this small living room-sized restaurant but just like with the pigeon, the staff stood back and did squat.  

I'd say the only good about this place was that I stomached the food I regretfully paid for.  The end.
author: Honest J.

description:
Pretty great food.  
Nice Customer Service. 
Pretty fast in take-out. 
Food and presentation is good. 
Just a little pricey compare to other tocarias. 
4 Stars!
author: Anthony J G.

description:
Stopped by for some quick take away food. Had the enchiladas. They were decent but nothing special. 

If you're hungry or close to starving, I was the latter, their enchiladas or quesadillas will definitely do it.
author: Rudi B.

description: This place needs new management or needs to go out of business. Absolute dog sh*t food and horrible customer service. The lady behind the counter threw everything at the foil and wrapped the burrito using the foil. Lots of fun to open up because she didn't drain the beans or chicken (why is the chicken floating in soup anyway?). I asked for the steak and stopped her when I saw what it looked like, opting instead for the chicken which was a lesser of two evils. I was too polite to leave the line after she started making this for me but I wish I had.
author: Michael R.

description: I used to love this place, but they recently began using mostly organ meat for their "grilled chicken".  Disgusting! Also really oily. Unless you love slimy liver, heart and lungs, think twice.
author: Jeff Y.

description: Convenient and decently priced, but wouldn't survive in the Mission.  Everything is watery and rather flavorless.
author: Mike D.

description:
I used to come to La Tortilla every now and then when I first moved to the City, and I always thought the food was good. I came here again pretty recently after a LONG hiatus (I'm guessing 8 or 9 months). The food is still good, the service is still friendly, they're still quick with orders, and based on all this I would give them four stars. One thing has changed though...the prices! Like I said I hadn't been here in awhile so maybe they went up awhile ago, but they now charge the same amount as "nicer" taqueria places in my neighborhood, and the food isn't as good as some of those places. 

I usually get the "Azteca" burrito w/chicken. This is basically La Tortilla's version of whatever obnoxiously large burrito a Mexican restaurant offers (they all have one). It comes with rice, beans, pico, choice of meat, and is covered with guac, sour cream (which I opt out on), enchilada sauce, and salsa (I opt for spicy). It's a very good burrito! In the past (and I noticed this again on my last visit), the chicken and rice can be dry. I usually just pour spicy salsa on it so it's all good.   

The restaurant itself is small and the staff is friendly. They're quick with orders, which is nice (it's one of those places where you order when you walk in, and by the time it's your turn to pay your food is usually ready). 

I don't know if I'd justify dealing with finding parking in the Castro for an $8 burrito that I can get at places closer to my house, but this place is A-OK.
author: George A.

description:
Food is mediocre at best. Zapata, 1/2 block away is much better. 

I've been a few times without incident (food still bod good), but had bad experiences twice. This time, the pollo asado burrito had 5 chunks of chicken with in edible gristle.

One other time, they served the guy in line behind me first. I asked, and he did not know them. He guessed he was served first because he was Mexican. Wow.
author: Brent M.

description: This is the best Mexican food place in the Castro. Feels like family. Graciella and Veronica are awesome. Almost like our second moms everytime we walk in. They make the food taste even better! Check this place out! Worth the long lines ;)
author: Alan M.

description:
This is our go-to burrito place when we're not up for a walk to the mission. It's nothing fancy and you have to stick to the meats (the fish just isn't the thing to order here). But they've got options for tortillas (wheat, sundried tomato, and spinach) and decent carnitas and chicken mole.

They've got beers, mexican coke, and horchata and the gentleman that works the cashier remembers me and is always very friendly.
author: Nikki M.

description:
This review is based largely on the chile they have available. 

Honestly, the burrito was nothing special, I still prefer el farrolitos. However considering where this place is, it is CHEAP. I mean 7 bucks for a shrimp burrito? I'm down! At el toro the thing costs near 10 bucks! 
I actually really liked the food, but then again, I'm not a vegetarian like a lot of a lot of these other reviewers, 
THE CHILE. Oh god the chile! It was so goooooood! As in it was spicy as hell! So If anything, go for the incredibly delicious chile.
author: Veronica D.

description:
Best cheap food in the Castro!

The chips can be greasy...

I eat there 2-3 times a week
author: Peter W.

description:
I've been to La Tortilla twice and I can confidently say this food is terrible.  I don't care if you're drunk and it's the only place open at one in the morning.  I wish Chipotle would move in across the street and put this place out of its misery.

Ambiance: Dirty.

Service (gluten-free dairy-free perspective):  I'm not sure if there's a language barrier or they simply just don't care, but trying to explain you have gluten and dairy allergies is futile.  I ordered no cheese and yet a wealth of cheese somehow still made it into my taco.

Food: I've had better microwave oven meals.
author: G B.

description:
Pros: 
Friendly quick service. Get the fish burrito, the fish is individually fried freshly for each order. Very delicious!

Cons:Had the nopalitos one once and it was overly salty. I wish they had a spicier salsa.

Fazit: Overall I like this place and will keep coming back!
author: Elena W.

description:
Mediocre over-priced Mexican food with attitude and bland beans.  Meh.

Bland is the name of the game here:  bland carnitas, bland refried beans, even bland pozole!  The guacamole is a watery mess with barely any avocado in it at all...skimping on the avocado is a big no-no if you want a good review from me!!  Especially when the prices aren't cheap...let's just say they reflect the "Castro Mark-up".

My main beef (pardoning any puns) was that on my most recent visit here (I've been multiple times), the service left much to be desired:  the woman behind the counter was unpleasant, acted as though she was doing me a favor by serving me, as though each spoon she had to lift to fill my order was a huge inconvenience for her.  The man I presumed was her boss had to intervene and act as a communication intermediary between her and me several times, which wasn't a language barrier, because I speak both English and Spanish conversationally.  It was just an attitude barrier.

In a city full of great taquerias, some as close as a block and a half away, why bother going here?
author: Amy L.

description:
I really don't mind this place and I like their burritos but sometimes they're a hit or a miss, depending on who preps them; sometimes it's too salty and some other times it's tasteless! Not sure why they can't get it right?! Don't they use a standard recipe and don't they get training on how to prepare everything consistently every time? 

The space is really crammed with chairs and tables and a bit hard to move around. The bathroom is right next to the dining tables which can make for a nasty dining experience when people are using it. They are in desperate need of a renovation! Half the people working there, don't speak English or pretend not to and yet they love your money, business, and their tips & jobs! Regardless, I always tip, even though, most people don't, simply because it's considered an express joint. 

And YES, I would still go there, I like their burritos, much better than Zappata's!
author: Marc N.

description:
2.5 stars

PROS:
- open til 2am Fri-Sun
- grilled chicken regular  burrito ($6.25) comes with rice, beans, salsa
- super burrito ($7.75)  is basically a choice of meat, plus the above with sour cream, guacamole and cheese
- With the buy 1 get 1 free burrito (with the purchase of two drinks) coupon through the mail allowed me to get my burrito for free! meal total was only $11.50

CONS:
- Horchata tastes too chalky and not sweet enough. 
- The seat cushions are dirty and ratty looking.  The floor is dirty too.
- The lady chopping the ham on the counter was holding it with her bare hands.  tsk. tsk.

I don't know if I'll go back again.  On the other hand, maybe I will if I get another coupon in the mail!
author: Janice C.

description:
La Tortilla takes the prize for blandest Mexican food I have ever consumed in my life.  If you have a fussy friend who avoids Mexican food because its spicy, than this is the place for them.  I spent way too much money for 2 tacos and a beer, and took them up on the complimentary chips while I waited for my food to be cooked.  They have a good selection of salsas and such at their bar, though while I am normally a voracious eater of free tortilla chips, even these were too bland to convince me to expend the calories.  

Service was slow and the staff were mostly neutral in demeanor.  

One thing this place has going for it is the seating - my friend and I sat in the big open front windows, where we enjoyed the Castro's warm sun and a surprisingly nude passerby (if you can truly be nude while carrying a messenger bag)  Unfortunately, I don't think its enough to bring me back.
author: Virginia B.

description: Here is the worst Mexican place I've been . I ordered a super burrito from a rude Mexican lady and got the tasteless burrito ever. Food and place are both gross . Never gonna eat something from here again.
author: Kevin S.

description: Tried to come here to grab a quick burrito. The owner didn't want any more customers even though there was a long line of people anxiously awaiting to spend their money at his business. As I try to walk in the door, the man physically pushed me really hard and said "no mas!". I told him I just was trying to get some food, and he continued to yell at me in Spanish. I'm sorry, but if you have a line full of people that want to spend money at your business, then it's simply bad business for you to close your doors at that time. Second of all, it's even worse business to physically lay your hands on your customer in a violent way!
